Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw and correctly label their chosen habitat, indicating whether it is on land or in water.
The student can include and label a variety of plants in the habitat such as trees and grasses, demonstrating an understanding of plant diversity.
The student can include and label a range of animals appropriately within the habitat, like lizards and squirrels.
The student can identify and depict some patterns in the types of living things through grouping or arrangement, showing basic understanding of ecological diversity.
CANNOT: The student may not fully accurate or detailed in depicting the differences between two habitats if attempting a comparison (e.g., some elements might overlap or not be clearly distinguished).
The student might occasionally label plants or animals incorrectly or miss some elements entirely (e.g., labeling a water-based plant as land-based).
